docs.snippet: U.S. Customs & Border Protection (CBP) has informed U.S. airlines that they can once again board travelers who had been barred by an executive order last week, after it was blocked nationwide on Friday by a federal judge in Seattle, an airline...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Customs & Border Protection (CBP) has informed U.S. airlines that they can once again board travelers who had been barred by an executive order last week, after it was blocked nationwide on Friday by a federal judge in Seattle, an airline official told Reuters.

headline.main: U.S. Customs Give Airlines Green Light to Board All Visa-Holders After Seattle Ruling
headline.print_headline: U.S. Customs Give Airlines Green Light to Board All Visa-Holders After Seattle Ruling

docs.snippet: The U.S. State Department was informed by the Justice Department of the ruling by a Washington state court blocking U.S. President Donald Trump's order barring nationals from seven countries from entering the United States, a State Department spok...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. State Department was informed by the Justice Department of the ruling by a Washington state court blocking U.S. President Donald Trump's order barring nationals from seven countries from entering the United States, a State Department spokesperson said on Friday.

headline.main: State Department Informed of Court Ruling on Trump's Immigration Order: Spokesperson

headline.main: U.S. Not Weighing Middle East Troop Hikes Over Iran Concerns: Mattis

docs.snippet: A U.S. law enforcement agency is considering transferring some federal agents to Chicago to combat violence in the nation's third-largest city, where homicides last year reached a 20-year high, a spokesman for the agency said on Friday....
